abstract.text: Converts a floating-point 32-bit-per-channel, 4-channel buffer to an 8-bit-per-channel, 4-channel buffer using the specified dithering algorithm.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to a vImage buffer structure that contains the source image whose data you want to convert.
A pointer to the destination vImage buffer structure. You’re responsible for filling out the
, and

fields of this structure, and for allocating a data buffer of the appropriate size. On return, the data buffer this structure points to contains the destination image data. When you no longer need the data buffer, deallocate the memory to prevent memory leaks.
The four maximum source pixel values.
The four minimum source pixel values.
Type of dithering to apply to the image, if any.
An array of four 8-bit integers with the values
, and 3, in some order. Each value specifies the channel from the source image that the function copies to the destination channel at the corresponding index.
The options to use when performing the operation. If your code implements its own tiling or its own multithreading, pass
; otherwise, pass
; otherwise, one of the error codes in
This function supports the following dithering algorithms:
Doesn’t apply any dithering. This algorithm rounds the input values to the nearest representable value in the destination format.

Adds precomputed blue noise to the source image before it rounds the input values to the nearest representable value in the destination format. The vImage conversion functions support uniform and Gaussian noise by including
and
, respectively.
Returns the same result as
but uses the same offset into the blue noise for each call.
Applies Floyd-Steinberg dithering to the image.
Applies Atkinson dithering to the image.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
A type for a four-channel, 32-bits-per-channel, floating-point pixel.
Apply dithering to simulate colors that are unavailable in reduced bit depths.

doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation.title: Improving the quality of quantized images with dithering

abstract.text: A constant that indicates the conversion will add Atkinson dithering to the image.
A constant that indicates the conversion will add Floyd-Steinberg dithering to the image.
A constant that indicates the conversion will not apply dithering.
A constant that indicates the conversion will add randomized, pre-computed blue noise to the image.
A constant that indicates the conversion will add reproducible, pre-computed blue noise to the image.
A constant that indicates the conversion will distribute the noise according to a Gaussian distribution.
A constant that indicates the conversion will distribute the noise uniformly.
A flag that disables vImage internal tiling routines.
The vImage function completed without error.
A flag that sets the behavior to the default.
Converts a floating-point 32-bit-per-channel, 4-channel buffer to an 8-bit-per-channel, 4-channel buffer using the specified dithering algorithm.
Converts a floating-point 32-bit-per-channel, 3-channel buffer to an 8-bit-per-channel, 3-channel buffer using the specified dithering algorithm.
An image buffer that stores an image’s pixel data, dimensions, and row stride.
The height of the image, in pixels.
The distance, in bytes, between the start of one pixel row and the next in an image, including any unused space between them.
The width of the image, in pixels.
A type for image errors.
A type for processing options.
Look up type aliases, data types, and constants the vImage library uses.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.
A single-precision, floating-point value type.
A 32-bit signed integer value type.
An 8-bit unsigned integer value type.
